actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to impose fees upon obligations of Government-Sponsored Enterprises and for other purposes.
short_title: Government-Sponsored Enterprises User Fee Act of 1985
subjects: Department of Housing and Urban Development

summary.text: Government-Sponsored Enterprises User Fee Act of 1985 - Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to assess each Government-sponsored enterprise a quarterly fee based on the amount of the outstanding obligations of such enterprise. Imposes interest charges on late payments. Defines a Government-sponsored enterprise as the Federal Home Loan Banks, the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation, the Federal National Mortgage Association, the Central and Regional Banks for Cooperatives, the Federal Intermediate Credit Banks, the Federal Land Banks, the Student Loan Marketing Association, their subsidiaries, and subsequently created entities with analogous functions.

titles.title: Government-Sponsored Enterprises User Fee Act of 1985
A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to impose fees upon obligations of Government-Sponsored Enterprises and for other purposes.
